title: What PE install do i need?

forumNotes.author: p8ntballgod87
forumNotes.content: Heres my situation, i am a computer tech that is responsible for 35 pcs a day all of them are different model laptop and desktops, all running at least vista basic. I need a method to boot from a usb HDD so i can run diagnostic apps. Right now im using bartpe but its a pain to rebuild the ISO everytime i need to change the diagnostic apps. What i was thinking was to install xp or win 7 32 bit onto the drive from a laptop and then move it from pc to pc. So when a change needs to be made i simple boot it-make the change and shutdown. BUT i have had problems with booting different pcs it will BSOD, im guessing cuz of the different chipsets/USB...is there a way to do it thus way but somehow strip away the USB/CHIPSET drivers at shutdown so when a diff pc is booted it will simply imstall the new drivers?

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
There are two differnt "sets" of problems: * USB drivers (the services are normally set to non-boot priority) * Chipset drivers
Things you should read: Stickies here: [http://www.boot-land...hp?showforum=77](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showforum=77 "External link") This thread: [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=9051](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=9051 "External link") And this one: [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=9227](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=9227 "External link") This said there is NOT any need to use a PE from the .iso, it can be used from HD allright, and of course in this case it is easier to update/add drivers. A PE 2.x (Vista based) or 3.x (windows 7 based) may be the solution for you. :smile: In case looky here: [http://www.boot-land...hp?showforum=51](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showforum=51 "External link") and/or here: [http://www.boot-land...hp?showforum=91](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showforum=91 "External link") jaclaz

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> I under stand that but if you look at the post by KTP he states that he has used the method for vista AND win 7.

NO. :smile:  

I know I do seem picky (mostly because I am :smile:), but in this kind of matters one has to be very, very accurate.  

What **ktp** stated was that ***since*** the method as originally explained by **karyonix** for **Windows 7** on a **Windows 7** install **FAILED**, he tried on the **Windows 7** the same method (usb_all.reg ) already known and working for ***Vista*** .  
In other words, he applied an "old" "Vista tested" method on the Windows 7 based build, additionally, as ***opposed*** to applying the "new" Windows 7 method to a Vista build.  

If you want a "full" Vista USB build, use a **Vista** USB tutorial method, check links in Dietmar's Signature:  
[http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=14181](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=14181 "External link")
